4 Program Prioritas Menteri Ekonomi Jokowi Hingga 2024
07 Nov 2019, 10:06 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian, Airlangga Hartarto, telah mengumpulkan beberapa menteri dan pejabat negara di bawah koordinasi instansi yang dipimpinnya. Dalam acara tersebut dibahas mengenai rancangan program prioritas dan program kerja 2020-2024 di bidang perekonomian. Menurut Airlangga, ada empat kelompok program yang disasar Pemerintah."Rapat hari ini adalah langkah awal untuk koordinasi dan sinkronisasi kerangka pikir dari program yang selaras antara Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian dengan Kementerian/Lembaga di lingkup perekonomian," kata Airlangga di Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Program prioritas pertama adalah mendorong pertumbuhan ekonomi yang berkualitas. Kedua, program untuk meningkatkan pemerataan ekonomi dan pengurangan kesenjangan (Inklusif). Ketiga, program untuk mendukung keberlanjutan ekonomi (Sustainability). Keempat, program untuk meningkatkan daya saing ekonomi (Competitiveness).Untuk tahap awal, Airlangga menyebut ada 15 usulan program prioritas yang diharapkan tuntas dalam 6 bulan ke depan. Adapun program prioritas tersebut antara lain program implementasi mandatori B30, perbaikan ekosistem ketenagakerjaan, jaminan produk halal (JPH), penelitian dan pengembangan industri farmasi, dan penguatan Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI).Lalu, Ada pula mengenai perbaikan kebijakan Kredit Usaha Rakyat (KUR), penerapan Kartu Pra Kerja, pengembangan kawasan Batam, Bintan, dan Karimun (BBK), gasifikasi batubara, pengembangan hortikultura berorientasi ekspor, kemitraan pertanian berbasis teknologi, percepatan elektronifikasi keuangan daerah, green refinery, dan omnibus law cipta kerja."Sebelumnya Presiden sudah mengatakan bahwa 6 bulan pertama yang akan menentukan kondisi ekonomi kita. Tantangan kita adalah apakah kita bisa menangani persoalan-persoalan yang timbul di tengah perekonomian yang slow down," jelasnya.Usai rapat koordinasi kali ini, para menteri di bawah Kemenko Perekonomian beserta para Eselon I masing-masing akan menindaklanjuti hasil keputusan rakor. Menurut Airlangga dalam waktu 10 hari ke depan akan dilaksanakan rapat koordinasi (rakor) lanjutannya.Sementara itu, Sekretaris Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Susiwijono menambahkan, kerangka pikir penyusunan program-program tersebut tentunya sejalan dengan visi-misi Presiden RI, Rencana Pembangunan Jangka Menengah Nasional (RPJMN), Rencana Kerja Pemerintah (RKP), Rencana Kerja dan Angkaran Kementerian/Lembaga (RKA/KL), hingga Nota Keuangan.Susiwijono menuturkan, ada beberapa kriteria program atau kegiatan di K/L yang akan dikoordinasikan di Kemenko Perekonomian. Pertama yang bersifat strategis dan berdampak luas kepada masyarakat. Kedua yang bersifat lintas sektoral dan berimplikasi luas pada kinerja K/L lain."Kemudian kriteria ketiga adalah yang berskala nasional, penting, strategis, dan berdampak luas ke masyarakat. Serta kriteria terakhir yang menyerap banyak tenaga kerja, investasi besar, dan high-tech," kata Susi.Mengenai usulan 15 program prioritas tersebut, Susiwijono menjelaskan bahwa tim Kemenko Perekonomian telah menyiapkan deskripsi program, sasaran/tujuan, uraian program/kegiatan, target/indikator kinerja, beserta kerangka waktu/jadwal pelaksanaan dari masing-masing program."Dengan begitu, kita berharap hal ini akan memudahkan kita dalam menindaklanjuti dan menuntaskan 15 program prioritas tersebut dengan baik," ujarnya.Hadir dalam kesempatan ini antara lain: Menteri Agraria dan Tata Ruang/Kepala Badan Pertanahan Nasional, Menteri Perindustrian, Menteri Ketenagakerjaan, Menteri Perdagangan, Menteri Pertanian, Menteri Koperasi dan Usaha Kecil dan Menengah, Menteri Riset dan Teknologi/ Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional, Wakil Menteri Keuangan, Wakil Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN), Kepala Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS), dan Kepala Badan Informasi Geospasial (BIG). 4 Priority Programs of the Minister of Economy Jokowi Until 2024
Nov 7 2019, 10:06 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, has gathered several ministers and state officials under the coordination of the agency he leads. In the event the priority program design and work program 2020-2024 were discussed in the economic field. According to Airlangga, there are four program groups targeted by the Government. "Today's meeting is the first step to coordinating and synchronizing the mindset of a program that is aligned between the Coordinating Ministry of Economic Affairs and Ministries / Institutions in the economic sphere," Airlangga said at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). The first priority program is to encourage quality economic growth. Second, programs to improve economic equality and reduce inequality (inclusive). Third, programs to support economic sustainability (Sustainability). Fourth, a program to improve economic competitiveness (Competitiveness). For the initial stage, Airlangga said there were 15 priority program proposals that were expected to be completed within the next 6 months. The priority programs include the implementation of the B30 mandatory program, improvement of the employment ecosystem, halal product guarantee (JPH), research and development of the pharmaceutical industry, and strengthening the Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI). Then, there are also improvements to the People's Business Credit (KUR) policy ), the application of Pre-Work Cards, Batam, Bintan and Karimun (BBK) areas, coal gasification, export-oriented horticulture development, technology-based agricultural partnerships, accelerated regional financial electronification, green refineries, and working copyright omnibuses. said that the first 6 months will determine our economic conditions. Our challenge is whether we can handle the problems that arise in the midst of a slow down economy, "he explained. After the coordination meeting this time, the ministers under the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy along with the Echelon I each will follow up on the results of the coordination meeting decision. According to Airlangga within the next 10 days a follow-up coordination meeting (Rakor) will be held. Meanwhile, Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Susiwijono added, the framework for the preparation of these programs would certainly be in line with the vision and mission of the President of the Republic of Indonesia, the National Medium-Term Development Plan ( RPJMN), Government Work Plan (RKP), Work Plan and Ministry / Institution Transportation (RKA / KL), to the Financial Note. Suswijono said, there are several program or activity criteria in K / L to be coordinated at the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy. The first is strategic and has a wide impact on society. The second is cross-sectoral and has wide implications on the performance of other Ministries / Agencies. "Then the third criterion is the national scale, important, strategic, and broad impact to the community. And the last criterion that absorbs a lot of labor, large investments, and high-tech , "said Susi. Regarding the proposed 15 priority programs, Susiwijono explained that the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy had prepared a description of the program, goals / objectives, a description of the program / activity, performance targets / indicators, along with a timeframe / schedule for implementation of each program." That way, we hope this will facilitate us in following up and completing the 15 priority programs well, "he said. Present on this occasion include: Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning / Head of National Land Agency, Minister of Industry, Minister of Manpower, Minister of Trade , Minister of Agriculture, Minister of Cooperatives and Small and Medium Enterprises, Minister of Research and Technology / Research Agency and National Innovation, Deputy Minister of Finance, Deputy Minister of State Owned Enterprises (BUMN), Head of the Central Statistics Agency (BPS), and Head of the Geospatial Information Agency (BIG).
